name: wag
content:
wag verb
(MOVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen: The little dog's tail wagged in delight. He wagged his finger sternly at the two boys.

wag verb
(MISS SCHOOL)
[ T ] Australian English Northern English informal to be absent from school without permission: There were days I would wag school and go for a ride on my bike. I used to wag it a lot. I didn't like school.
